info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 2:20PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Steuben, southeastern Branch, southwestern Hillsdale and northwestern Williams Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 220 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Edon, or 9 miles west of Montpelier, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 155 and 156. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Indiana...southeastern and southwestern Michigan...and northwestern Ohio.
